20101222020342.000|20101222020343.000|CC1|RATIFICATION VOTE TOMORROW.     
20101222020343.000|20101222020345.000|CC1|HOPING TO MITIGATE REPUBLICAN   
20101222020345.000|20101222020346.000|CC1|DOUBTS OVER WHETHER THE DEAL    
20101222020346.000|20101222020347.000|CC1|WAS TOUGH ENOUGH, THE           
20101222020347.000|20101222020349.000|CC1|PRESIDENT PROMISED TO           
20101222020349.000|20101222020350.000|CC1|STRENGTHEN MISSILE DEFENSE.     
20101222020350.000|20101222020352.000|CC1|IN THE END, 11 REPUBLICANS      
20101222020352.000|20101222020355.000|CC1|DECIDED TO SUPPORT THE TREATY.  
20101222020355.000|20101222020356.000|CC1|LAMAR ALEXANDER WAS THE         
20101222020356.000|20101222020358.000|CC1|HIGHEST RANKING MEMBER OF THE   
20101222020358.000|20101222020400.000|CC1|G.O.P. LEADERSHIP TO JOIN IN.   
20101222020400.000|20101222020401.000|CC1|>> I WILL VOTE TO RATIFY THE    
20101222020401.000|20101222020402.000|CC1|NEW START TREATY BETWEEN THE    
20101222020402.000|20101222020404.000|CC1|UNITED STATES AND RUSSIA        
20101222020404.000|20101222020406.000|CC1|BECAUSE IT LEAVES OUR COUNTRY

20101222020408.000|20101222020413.000|CC1|TO MR. ANY ATTACKER TO KINGDOM  
20101222020413.000|20101222020414.000|CC1|COME AND BECAUSE THE PRESIDENT  
20101222020414.000|20101222020416.000|CC1|HAS COMMITTED TO AN $85

20101222020426.000|20101222020427.000|CC1|CORKER OF TENNESSEE.            
20101222020427.000|20101222020429.000|CC1|>> THE QUESTION BECOMES TO ME   
20101222020429.000|20101222020433.000|CC1|AND FOR ALL OF US, ALL OF US

20101222020505.000|20101222020506.000|CC1|OTHERS WILL JOIN ME IN THAT

20101222020508.000|20101222020510.000|CC1|>> Ifill: NEW START WOULD

20101222020513.000|20101222020515.000|CC1|1,550 STRATEGIC NUCLEAR WAR

20101222020518.000|20101222020520.000|CC1|IT WOULD ALSO REINSTATE

20101222020522.000|20101222020524.000|CC1|THAT ENDED A YEAR AGO WHEN A

20101222020531.000|20101222020532.000|CC1|MEDVEDEV LAST APRIL.

20101222020534.000|20101222020535.000|CC1|BILLIONS IN NEW FUNDING TO      
20101222020535.000|20101222020537.000|CC1|UPGRADE THE U.S. NUCLEAR        
20101222020537.000|20101222020537.000|CC1|ARSENAL.

20101222020540.000|20101222020541.000|CC1|OUTCOME.

20101222020542.000|20101222020544.000|CC1|WE HAD A NUMBER OF SENATORS     
20101222020544.000|20101222020546.000|CC1|WHO WERE NOT HERE WHO WILL      
20101222020546.000|20101222020548.000|CC1|VOTE FOR THIS TREATY.           
20101222020548.000|20101222020552.000|CC1|SENATOR GREG, SENATOR BAYH,     
20101222020552.000|20101222020553.000|CC1|SENATOR WIDEN.

20101222020555.000|20101222020557.000|CC1|LOOK AT IT AS ALMOST 70 VOTES.

20101222020559.000|20101222020600.000|CC1|TODAY'S WASHINGTON, IN TODAY'S  
20101222020600.000|20101222020604.000|CC1|SENATE, 70 VOTES IS             
20101222020604.000|20101222020607.000|CC1|YESTERDAY'S 95.                 
20101222020607.000|20101222020610.000|CC1|I FEEL PRETTY GOOD ABOUT WHERE  
20101222020610.000|20101222020611.000|CC1|WE'VE GOTTEN TO.                
20101222020611.000|20101222020612.000|CC1|>> IN OUR NATIONAL SECURITY     
20101222020612.000|20101222020614.000|CC1|INTEREST, WE NEED THE NEW       
20101222020614.000|20101222020617.000|CC1|START TREATY NOW.               
20101222020617.000|20101222020618.000|CC1|FOR WELL OVER A YEAR WE HAVE    
20101222020618.000|20101222020620.000|CC1|HAD NO BOOTS ON THE GROUND IN   
20101222020620.000|20101222020620.000|CC1|HUSH I CAN'T.                   
20101222020620.000|20101222020623.000|CC1|I TAKE THAT VERY SERIOUSLY.     
20101222020623.000|20101222020624.000|CC1|I'M NOT THE ONLY ONE.           
20101222020624.000|20101222020625.000|CC1|>> Ifill: SOME TREATY           
20101222020625.000|20101222020626.000|CC1|OPPONENTS LIKE REPUBLICAN       
20101222020626.000|20101222020628.000|CC1|ORRIN HATCH OF UTAH             
20101222020628.000|20101222020629.000|CC1|ACKNOWLEDGED EARLY IN THE DAY   
20101222020629.000|20101222020631.000|CC1|THAT THE TIDE HAD TURNED.       
20101222020631.000|20101222020632.000|CC1|HE SAID WE KNOW WHEN WE'VE      
20101222020632.000|20101222020634.000|CC1|BEEN BEATEN.                    
20101222020634.000|20101222020636.000|CC1|BUT OTHER OBJECTING             
20101222020636.000|20101222020638.000|CC1|REPUBLICANS STOOD THEIR GROUND. 
20101222020638.000|20101222020639.000|CC1|>> THE ADMINISTRATION DID NOT   
20101222020639.000|20101222020640.000|CC1|NEGOTIATE A GOOD TREATY.        
20101222020640.000|20101222020642.000|CC1|THEY WENT INTO NEGOTIATIONS IT  
20101222020642.000|20101222020643.000|CC1|SEEMS TO ME WITH THE ATTITUDE   
20101222020643.000|20101222020645.000|CC1|WITH THE RUSSIANS JUST LIKE     
20101222020645.000|20101222020646.000|CC1|THE GUY THAT GOES INTO THE CAR  
20101222020646.000|20101222020648.000|CC1|DEALERSHIP AND SAYS I'M NOT     
20101222020648.000|20101222020648.000|CC1|LEAVING HERE UNTIL I BUY A      
20101222020648.000|20101222020650.000|CC1|CAR.                            
20101222020650.000|20101222020651.000|CC1|AND I THINK THAT'S THE          
20101222020651.000|20101222020652.000|CC1|APPROACH THAT WAS TAKEN AND     
20101222020652.000|20101222020654.000|CC1|THE RESULT IS PRETTY CLEAR.     
20101222020654.000|20101222020655.000|CC1|>> Ifill: SOME ALSO COMPLAINED  
20101222020655.000|20101222020657.000|CC1|ABOUT RUSSIAN INSISTENCE THAT   
20101222020657.000|20101222020658.000|CC1|WORDING IN THE TREATY NOT BE    
20101222020658.000|20101222020659.000|CC1|CHANGED.                        
20101222020659.000|20101222020700.000|CC1|>> I THINK I UNDERSTAND WHY     
20101222020700.000|20101222020702.000|CC1|THE RUSSIANS DON'T WANT TO      
20101222020702.000|20101222020704.000|CC1|REOPEN THE TREATY.              
20101222020704.000|20101222020705.000|CC1|THEY'VE TOLD US TAKE IT OR      
20101222020705.000|20101222020706.000|CC1|LEAVE IT.                       
20101222020706.000|20101222020708.000|CC1|MY RESPONSE TO OUR RUSSIAN      
20101222020708.000|20101222020708.000|CC1|FRIENDS IS I CHOOSE TO LEAVE    
20101222020708.000|20101222020709.000|CC1|IT AT THIS TIME.                
20101222020709.000|20101222020711.000|CC1|>> Ifill: BUT ADMIRAL MIKE      
20101222020711.000|20101222020712.000|CC1|MULLEN THE CHAIRMAN OF THE      
20101222020712.000|20101222020714.000|CC1|JOINT CHIEFS WAS AMONG THOSE    
20101222020714.000|20101222020715.000|CC1|ADD TO GO THE LATE PRESSURE     
20101222020715.000|20101222020717.000|CC1|WITH A LETTER TO LAWMAKERS      
20101222020717.000|20101222020718.000|CC1|URGING PASSAGE.                 
20101222020718.000|20101222020720.000|CC1|IT READ IN PART, THIS TREATY    
20101222020720.000|20101222020721.000|CC1|ENHANCES OUR ABILITY TO         
20101222020721.000|20101222020723.000|CC1|PROTECT AND DEFEND THE          
20101222020723.000|20101222020724.000|CC1|CITIZENS OF THE UNITED STATES.  
20101222020724.000|20101222020727.000|CC1|I AM CONFIDENT IN ITS SUCCESS   
20101222020727.000|20101222020728.000|CC1|AS I AM IN ITS SAFEGUARDS.      
20101222020728.000|20101222020730.000|CC1|THE PRESIDENT, VICE PRESIDENT   
20101222020730.000|20101222020731.000|CC1|BIDEN, AND SECRETARY OF STATE   
20101222020731.000|20101222020734.000|CC1|CLINTON ALSO WORKED THE PHONES  
20101222020734.000|20101222020734.000|CC1|THROUGHOUT THE DAY.             
20101222020734.000|20101222020736.000|CC1|WHITE HOUSE SPOKESMAN ROBERT    
20101222020736.000|20101222020737.000|CC1|GIBBS SAID THE EFFORT WAS       
20101222020737.000|20101222020739.000|CC1|DESIGNED TO CHANGE WAIVERING    
20101222020739.000|20101222020739.000|CC1|MINDS.                          
20101222020739.000|20101222020740.000|CC1|>> I THINK THEY'VE HAD AN       
20101222020740.000|20101222020743.000|CC1|OPPORTUNITY TO FOCUS ON THOSE

20101222021329.000|20101222021331.000|CC1|IT CAME OUT OF COMMITTEE IN

20101222022632.000|20101222022635.000|CC1|ABOUT ETHNIC... INDIVIDUALS OF  
20101222022635.000|20101222022636.000|CC1|DIFFERENT ETHNIC BACKGROUNDS.   
20101222022636.000|20101222022636.000|CC1|>> ABSOLUTELY.                  
20101222022636.000|20101222022639.000|CC1|THOSE DATA SHOW VERY CLEARLY,   
20101222022639.000|20101222022641.000|CC1|I THINK IN THE LAST RELEASE,    
20101222022641.000|20101222022642.000|CC1|THE SUB URBANIZATION OF THE     
20101222022642.000|20101222022644.000|CC1|NEW IMMIGRANT POPULATIONS, THE  
20101222022644.000|20101222022646.000|CC1|NEW PHENOMENON.                 
20101222022646.000|20101222022649.000|CC1|SO WE THINK OF IMMIGRATION IN   
20101222022649.000|20101222022651.000|CC1|OLD TERMS AS A COASTAL          
20101222022651.000|20101222022652.000|CC1|PHENOMENON.                     
20101222022652.000|20101222022654.000|CC1|IT'S MAINLY AN URBAN            
20101222022654.000|20101222022654.000|CC1|PHENOMENON.                     
20101222022654.000|20101222022656.000|CC1|THAT'S CHANGING IN VERY         
20101222022656.000|20101222022657.000|CC1|DRAMATIC WAYS.

20101222022720.000|20101222022722.000|CC1|>> THE AMERICAN COMMUNITY

20101222023320.000|20101222023320.000|CC1|DISTRICT.

20101222023934.000|20101222023935.000|CC1|ACCESSIBLE TO PEOPLE DOING      
20101222023935.000|20101222023937.000|CC1|HOME VISITS IS A CRITICAL PART  
20101222023937.000|20101222023939.000|CC1|OF THE SUCCESS.                 
20101222023939.000|20101222023941.000|CC1|>> Suarez: LIKE THE REST OF     
20101222023941.000|20101222023942.000|CC1|THE DEVELOPING WORLD THERE'S    
20101222023942.000|20101222023944.000|CC1|NO DOCTOR SHORTAGE IN CUBA      
20101222023944.000|20101222023945.000|CC1|WHICH MEANS THE HEALTH CARE     
20101222023945.000|20101222023947.000|CC1|SYSTEM HERE CAN PUSH DOCTORS    
20101222023947.000|20101222023948.000|CC1|AND NURSES DOWN TO THE          
20101222023948.000|20101222023950.000|CC1|SMALLEST RURAL COMMUNITIES,     
20101222023950.000|20101222023951.000|CC1|PROVIDING A KIND OF CARE        
20101222023951.000|20101222023953.000|CC1|THAT'S BOTH PERSONAL AND        
20101222023953.000|20101222023957.000|CC1|PERSISTENT.                     
20101222023957.000|20101222024001.000|CC1|HERE IN A RURAL TOWN, THIS      
20101222024001.000|20101222024004.000|CC1|DOCTOR SPENDS EVERY AFTERNOON   
20101222024004.000|20101222024009.000|CC1|MAKING HOME VISITS.             
20101222024009.000|20101222024010.000|CC1|SHE REACHES ABOUT SIX HOMES A   
20101222024010.000|20101222024014.000|CC1|DAY.                            
20101222024014.000|20101222024015.000|CC1|AFTER SHE FINISHED MEDICAL      
20101222024015.000|20101222024017.000|CC1|SCHOOL, FREE OF COST FOR ALL    
20101222024017.000|20101222024019.000|CC1|CUBAN DOCTORS, THIS DOCTOR WAS  
20101222024019.000|20101222024020.000|CC1|ASSIGNED TO WORK IN THIS        
20101222024020.000|20101222024022.000|CC1|VILLAGE.                        
20101222024022.000|20101222024023.000|CC1|ALL NEW DOCTORS MUST WORK       
20101222024023.000|20101222024024.000|CC1|WHERE THE GOVERNMENT ASSIGNS    
20101222024024.000|20101222024026.000|CC1|THEM LIKE EVERYTHING IN CUBA    
20101222024026.000|20101222024027.000|CC1|THE GOVERNMENT KEEPS A CLOSE    
20101222024027.000|20101222024029.000|CC1|EYE ON MEDICAL EMPLOYMENT       
20101222024029.000|20101222024031.000|CC1|ENSURING THAT ALL CUBANS HAVE   
20101222024031.000|20101222024032.000|CC1|ACCESS TO CARE AND THAT EACH    
20101222024032.000|20101222024036.000|CC1|DOCTOR HAS NO MORE THAN 1,100   
20101222024036.000|20101222024037.000|CC1|PATIENTS.                       
20101222024037.000|20101222024039.000|CC1|ON THIS DAY, THE DOCTOR IS      
20101222024039.000|20101222024041.000|CC1|FOLLOWING UP ON AN 86-YEAR-OLD  
20101222024041.000|20101222024042.000|CC1|PATIENT WHO SUFFERED A HIP      
20101222024042.000|20101222024046.000|CC1|FRACTURE.                       
20101222024046.000|20101222024048.000|CC1|THE DOCTOR SAID HER EXAM        
20101222024048.000|20101222024049.000|CC1|DOESN'T ONLY CHECK THE          
20101222024049.000|20101222024049.000|CC1|PATIENT.                        
20101222024049.000|20101222024051.000|CC1|SHE'S ON THE LOOKOUT FOR OTHER  
20101222024051.000|20101222024051.000|CC1|HEALTH THREATS.                 
20101222024051.000|20101222024052.000|CC1|>> THE OBJECTIVE IS NOT JUST    
20101222024052.000|20101222024054.000|CC1|TO SEE THE SICK PERSON IN THE   
20101222024054.000|20101222024055.000|CC1|HOME BUT ALSO TO PREVENT        
20101222024055.000|20101222024056.000|CC1|ILLNESS.                        
20101222024056.000|20101222024058.000|CC1|WE DO A PHYSICAL EXAM OF        
20101222024058.000|20101222024100.000|CC1|EVERYONE IN THE HOME AND        
20101222024100.000|20101222024103.000|CC1|INSPECT THE LIVING CONDITIONS.  
20101222024103.000|20101222024106.000|CC1|>> Suarez: IT'S AGGRESSIVE      
20101222024106.000|20101222024107.000|CC1|PREVENTIVE MEDICINE.            
20101222024107.000|20101222024109.000|CC1|HOMES ARE INVESTIGATED, WATER   
20101222024109.000|20101222024110.000|CC1|QUALITY CHECKED.                
20101222024110.000|20101222024112.000|CC1|ELECTRICAL PLUGS CHECKED.       
20101222024112.000|20101222024113.000|CC1|ALL THE OTHER PEOPLE IN THE     
20101222024113.000|20101222024116.000|CC1|HOUSEHOLD ALSO GET A CHECK-UP.  
20101222024116.000|20101222024119.000|CC1|THIS DOCTOR IS WITH THE CUBAN   
20101222024119.000|20101222024123.000|CC1|MINISTRY OF PUBLIC HEALTH.      
20101222024123.000|20101222024125.000|CC1|>> PREVENTIVE MEDICINE IN CUBA  
20101222024125.000|20101222024126.000|CC1|IS A PREMISE.                   
20101222024126.000|20101222024127.000|CC1|THERE IS A SAYING, IT'S BETTER

20101222024129.000|20101222024131.000|CC1|CLIFF THAN TO PICK HIM UP

20101222024132.000|20101222024133.000|CC1|GROUND.

20101222024134.000|20101222024135.000|CC1|IS A VICTORY OF OUR             
20101222024135.000|20101222024139.000|CC1|REVOLUTION.                     
20101222024139.000|20101222024140.000|CC1|>> Suarez: IN SUCH A POOR       
20101222024140.000|20101222024142.000|CC1|COUNTRY, HOWEVER, IT'S NOT      
20101222024142.000|20101222024146.000|CC1|ALWAYS EASY TO TREAT ILLNESS.   
20101222024146.000|20101222024147.000|CC1|>> WHEN A CUBAN PATIENT GOES    
20101222024147.000|20101222024150.000|CC1|TO A HOSPITAL, HE MUST RELY ON  
20101222024150.000|20101222024151.000|CC1|THE RESOURCES AVAILABLE AT      
20101222024151.000|20101222024152.000|CC1|THAT MOMENT.                    
20101222024152.000|20101222024154.000|CC1|SOMETIMES A SIMPLE URINARY      
20101222024154.000|20101222024155.000|CC1|INFECTION CAN'T BE TREATED      
20101222024155.000|20101222024157.000|CC1|BECAUSE THEY DON'T HAVE THE

20101222024201.000|20101222024204.000|CC1|CON KRIK ILLNESSES.             
20101222024204.000|20101222024205.000|CC1|>> Suarez: THIS DOCTOR FLED     
20101222024205.000|20101222024207.000|CC1|CUBA IN THE EARLY '90s WHEN     
20101222024207.000|20101222024209.000|CC1|THE COUNTRY WAS IN SEVERE       
20101222024209.000|20101222024210.000|CC1|ECONOMIC CRISIS.                
20101222024210.000|20101222024212.000|CC1|HE BECAME FRUSTRATED WITH THE   
20101222024212.000|20101222024213.000|CC1|LIMITED FINANCIAL RESORES       
20101222024213.000|20101222024215.000|CC1|GIVEN TO CUBAN DOCTORS.         
20101222024215.000|20101222024220.000|CC1|HIS MIAMI, SOLIDARITY WITHOUT   
20101222024220.000|20101222024222.000|CC1|BORDERS, GIVES SCHOLARSHIPS TO  
20101222024222.000|20101222024223.000|CC1|NURSES AND DOCTORS WHO DEFECT   
20101222024223.000|20101222024225.000|CC1|FROM CUBA AND WANT TO RETRAIN   
20101222024225.000|20101222024228.000|CC1|AND GET BOARD CERTIFIED IN THE  
20101222024228.000|20101222024231.000|CC1|U.S.                            
20101222024231.000|20101222024232.000|CC1|>> CUBA LOOKS ABROAD TO SUPPLY  
20101222024232.000|20101222024235.000|CC1|THE CUBAN PEOPLE.               
20101222024235.000|20101222024237.000|CC1|EVERY KUHN AND HAS A FAMILY     
20101222024237.000|20101222024239.000|CC1|MEMBER ABROAD TO SEND MEDICINE  
20101222024239.000|20101222024240.000|CC1|PLUS THERE ARE ORGANIZATIONS    
20101222024240.000|20101222024241.000|CC1|LIKE OURS THAT SEND MEDICAL     
20101222024241.000|20101222024242.000|CC1|SUPPLIES.                       
20101222024242.000|20101222024244.000|CC1|>> Suarez: BUT GAIL REED SAYS   
20101222024244.000|20101222024245.000|CC1|ONE OF THE BIGGEST PROBLEMS     
20101222024245.000|20101222024247.000|CC1|REMAINS THE EMBARGO OF MODE     
20101222024247.000|20101222024249.000|CC1|SIN FROM U.S. PHARMACEUTICAL    
20101222024249.000|20101222024250.000|CC1|COMPANIES.                      
20101222024250.000|20101222024251.000|CC1|>> THERE ARE SERIOUS            
20101222024251.000|20101222024253.000|CC1|RESTRICTIONS ON PATENTED        
20101222024253.000|20101222024253.000|CC1|MEDICINES.

20101222024254.000|20101222024257.000|CC1|EXAMPLE, HAVE PATENTS THAT ARE  
20101222024257.000|20101222024259.000|CC1|20 YEARS AND NOW THE

20101222024301.000|20101222024302.000|CC1|ASKING FOR MORE TIME FOR THEIR  
20101222024302.000|20101222024302.000|CC1|PATENTS.

20101222024306.000|20101222024308.000|CC1|CUBA IN REGULAR COMMERCIAL      
20101222024308.000|20101222024310.000|CC1|TERMS.                          
20101222024310.000|20101222024312.000|CC1|>> Suarez: BECAUSE OF THE U.S.  
20101222024312.000|20101222024313.000|CC1|GOVERNMENT'S TRADE EMBARGO,     
20101222024313.000|20101222024314.000|CC1|CUBA HAS CREATED ITS OWN

20101222024319.000|20101222024320.000|CC1|VACCINES.                       
20101222024320.000|20101222024323.000|CC1|INCLUDING ONE FOR HEPATITIS B   
20101222024323.000|20101222024325.000|CC1|NOW VIRTUALLY ELIMINATED FROM   
20101222024325.000|20101222024326.000|CC1|THE COUNTRY.

20101222024333.000|20101222024339.000|CC1|>> IN THE SENSE THAT IT

20101222024341.000|20101222024342.000|CC1|IT CREATED GREAT SUFFERING BUT

20101222024345.000|20101222024346.000|CC1|TRYING TO RESOLVE OUR OWN

20101222024348.000|20101222024350.000|CC1|CAPABLE OF PRODUCING THE VERY   
20101222024350.000|20101222024353.000|CC1|LATEST MEDICINES.               
20101222024353.000|20101222024354.000|CC1|>>uarez: ACCORDING TO THIS      
20101222024354.000|20101222024357.000|CC1|DOCTOR, THE CUBAN BIOTECH       
20101222024357.000|20101222024359.000|CC1|SECTORED HAS GARNERED 230       
20101222024359.000|20101222024400.000|CC1|PATENTS AND IS MARKETING ITS    
20101222024400.000|20101222024402.000|CC1|PRODUCTS IN 57 COUNTRIES.

20101222024404.000|20101222024406.000|CC1|INDUSTRY IN CUBA.               
20101222024406.000|20101222024408.000|CC1|STILL SOME ASK IF LIVING TO

20101222024427.000|20101222024428.000|CC1|16 YEARS AND IS NOW IN THE      
20101222024428.000|20101222024430.000|CC1|PROCESS OF GETTING HIS

20101222024433.000|20101222024440.000|CC1|>> I HAD TO DO EVERYTHING.

20101222024455.000|20101222024459.000|CC1|TUNNEL.                         
20101222024459.000|20101222024501.000|CC1|>> Suarez: BUT IN CUBA, THE     
20101222024501.000|20101222024502.000|CC1|REWARDS FOR DOCTORS ARE OFTEN   
20101222024502.000|20101222024504.000|CC1|TALKED ABOUT IN PHILOSOPHICAL

20101222024507.000|20101222024509.000|CC1|CONSIDERED A BASIC RIGHT.       
20101222024509.000|20101222024510.000|CC1|PREVENTING ILLNESS IS

20101222024524.000|20101222024525.000|CC1|>> EDUCATION HERE IN CUBA IS    
20101222024525.000|20101222024526.000|CC1|FREE.                           
20101222024526.000|20101222024527.000|CC1|SO PROVIDING GOOD MEDICAL       
20101222024527.000|20101222024528.000|CC1|STAFF FOR CUBANS IS

20101222024530.000|20101222024531.000|CC1|BUT IT IS ALSO CONSIDERED AN    
20101222024531.000|20101222024534.000|CC1|HONOR.                          
20101222024534.000|20101222024536.000|CC1|>> Suarez: IN AN ERA WHEN       
20101222024536.000|20101222024538.000|CC1|COUNTRIES ARE STRUGGLING TO DO

20101222024539.000|20101222024541.000|CC1|HEALTH CARE DOLLARS CUBA'S

20101222024543.000|20101222024545.000|CC1|LIKELY TO BE CLOSELY WATCHED.   
20101222024545.000|20101222024547.000|CC1|>> Ifill: TOMORROW RAY WILL     
20101222024547.000|20101222024548.000|CC1|REPORT                          
20101222024548.000|20101222024549.000|CC1|>> Ifill: TOMORROW RAY AND THE  
20101222024549.000|20101222024550.000|CC1|GLOBAL HEALTH UNIT WILL REPORT  
20101222024550.000|20101222024551.000|CC1|ON ONE OF CUBA'S CHOICE EXPORTS:
20101222024551.000|20101222024557.000|CC1|DOCTORS.                        
20101222024557.000|20101222024558.000|CC1|>> Woodruff: NOW, TO NEW RULES  
20101222024558.000|20101222024601.000|CC1|FOR REGULATING INTERNET TRAFFIC.
20101222024601.000|20101222024603.000|CC1|JEFFREY BROWN HAS THAT STORY.   
20101222024603.000|20101222024605.000|CC1|>> Brown: ON THE INFORMATION    
20101222024605.000|20101222024606.000|CC1|SUPERHIGHWAY THAT IS THE        
20101222024606.000|20101222024607.000|CC1|INTERNET, WHAT, IF ANY, RULES   
20101222024607.000|20101222024608.000|CC1|SHOULD THERE BE FOR, SAY, SPEED 
20101222024608.000|20101222024612.000|CC1|LIMITS OR PUBLIC ACCESS?        
20101222024612.000|20101222024613.000|CC1|SHOULD SUCH DECISIONS BE LEFT TO
20101222024613.000|20101222024614.000|CC1|THOSE WHO BUILD THE NETWORK, THE
20101222024614.000|20101222024615.000|CC1|SO-CALLED GATEKEEPERS OF THE    
20101222024615.000|20101222024616.000|CC1|WEB?                            
20101222024616.000|20101222024616.000|CC1|AND WHAT'S THE PROPER ROLE FOR  
20101222024616.000|20101222024617.000|CC1|GOVERNMENT REGULATION OF ONLINE 
20101222024617.000|20101222024621.000|CC1|TRAFFIC?                        
20101222024621.000|20101222024622.000|CC1|TODAY THE FEDERAL COMMUNICATIONS
20101222024622.000|20101222024623.000|CC1|COMMISSION TOOK A MAJOR AND     
20101222024623.000|20101222024625.000|CC1|CONTROVERSIAL STEP TOWARD       
20101222024625.000|20101222024626.000|CC1|ANSWERING SOME OF THOSE         
20101222024626.000|20101222024627.000|CC1|QUESTIONS, APPROVING ITS FIRST  
20101222024627.000|20101222024628.000|CC1|RULES FOR INTERNET ACCESS, OFTEN
20101222024628.000|20101222024631.000|CC1|REFERRED TO AS NET NEUTRALITY.  
20101222024631.000|20101222024633.000|CC1|HERE TO EXPLAIN IS CECILIA KANG,
20101222024633.000|20101222024634.000|CC1|TECHNOLOGY REPORTER FOR THE     
20101222024634.000|20101222024638.000|CC1|"WASHINGTON POST."              
20101222024638.000|20101222024640.000|CC1| WELCOME TO YOU.                
20101222024640.000|20101222024641.000|CC1|LET'S DEFINE THE TERMS FIRST    
20101222024641.000|20101222024643.000|CC1|BECAUSE WE USE THAT SORT OF     
20101222024643.000|20101222024645.000|CC1|UGLY TERM NET NEUTRALITY.       
20101222024645.000|20101222024646.000|CC1|>> IT IS CERTAINLY UGLY.        
20101222024646.000|20101222024648.000|CC1|IT MAKES ONE WANT TO FALL       
20101222024648.000|20101222024648.000|CC1|ASLEEP.                         
20101222024648.000|20101222024650.000|CC1|NET NEUTRALITY IS THE IDEA--    
20101222024650.000|20101222024652.000|CC1|AND IT'S A VERY BASIC           
20101222024652.000|20101222024653.000|CC1|PRINCIPLE-- THAT A CONSUMER     
20101222024653.000|20101222024654.000|CC1|SHOULD BE ABLE TO ACCESS ANY    
20101222024654.000|20101222024656.000|CC1|INTERNET SERVICE, ANY INTERNET  
20101222024656.000|20101222024658.000|CC1|CONTENT THAT THEY CHOOSE ON...  
20101222024658.000|20101222024702.000|CC1|TO THEIR LIKING, ON THEIR       
20101222024702.000|20101222024705.000|CC1|WIRELESS PHONE, ON THEIR HOME   
20101222024705.000|20101222024705.000|CC1|COMPUTER, WHATEVER THEY WANT    
20101222024705.000|20101222024707.000|CC1|TO ACCESS THEY SHOULD HAVE THE  
20101222024707.000|20101222024709.000|CC1|ABILITY TO ACCESS UNIMPEDED.    
20101222024709.000|20101222024711.000|CC1|NO FAST LANES, NO SLOW LANES.   
20101222024711.000|20101222024712.000|CC1|NO CONTENT THAT IS BLOCKED.     
20101222024712.000|20101222024715.000|CC1|THAT MEANS IF YOU WANT TO       
20101222024715.000|20101222024716.000|CC1|ACCESS A FACEBOOK APPLICATION   
20101222024716.000|20101222024717.000|CC1|ON YOUR CELL PHONE YOU SHOULD   
20101222024717.000|20101222024718.000|CC1|BE ABLE TO.                     
20101222024718.000|20101222024719.000|CC1|IF YOU WANT TO DO A GOOGLE      
20101222024719.000|20101222024721.000|CC1|SEARCH ON YOUR COMPUTER AT      
20101222024721.000|20101222024722.000|CC1|HOME, YOU SHOULD BE ABLE TO.    
20101222024722.000|20101222024724.000|CC1|IT SHOULD NOT BE THE... THE     
20101222024724.000|20101222024726.000|CC1|RESULT SHOULD NOT BE ANY        
20101222024726.000|20101222024727.000|CC1|SLOWER OR FASTER THAN SAY       
20101222024727.000|20101222024728.000|CC1|MICROSOFT.                      
20101222024728.000|20101222024729.000|CC1|>> Brown: BEFORE WE GET TO

20101222024731.000|20101222024732.000|CC1|TO CONTINUE THE EXPLANATION, I  
20101222024732.000|20101222024736.000|CC1|MEAN SOMETIMES WE ASK THE "WHY  
20101222024736.000|20101222024738.000|CC1|DO WE CARE" QUESTION.

20101222024740.000|20101222024741.000|CC1|A LOT ABOUT THIS.

20101222025332.000|20101222025335.000|CC1|FOR THIS.
